trans-unit.source: Create a PHP-MySQL web app in Azure App Service and deploy using FTP
trans-unit.target: Create a PHP-MySQL web app in Azure App Service and deploy using FTP

trans-unit.source: A tutorial that demonstrates how to create a PHP web app that stores data in MySQL and use FTP deployment to Azure.
trans-unit.target: A tutorial that demonstrates how to create a PHP web app that stores data in MySQL and use FTP deployment to Azure.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to create a PHP-MySQL web app and how to deploy it using FTP.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to create a PHP-MySQL web app and how to deploy it using FTP.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial assumes you have <linkText>PHP[install-php]</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>MySQL[install-mysql]</linkText><title></title>, a web server, and an FTP client installed on your computer.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial assumes you have <linkText>PHP[install-php]</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>MySQL[install-mysql]</linkText><title></title>, a web server, and an FTP client installed on your computer.

trans-unit.source: The instructions in this tutorial can be followed on any operating system, including Windows, Mac, and Linux.
trans-unit.target: The instructions in this tutorial can be followed on any operating system, including Windows, Mac, and Linux.

trans-unit.source: Upon completing this guide, you will have a PHP/MySQL web app running in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Upon completing this guide, you will have a PHP/MySQL web app running in Azure.

trans-unit.source: You will learn:
trans-unit.target: You will learn:

trans-unit.source: How to create a web app and a MySQL database using the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: How to create a web app and a MySQL database using the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: Because PHP is enabled in Web Apps by default, nothing special is required to run your PHP code.
trans-unit.target: Because PHP is enabled in Web Apps by default, nothing special is required to run your PHP code.

trans-unit.source: How to publish your application to Azure using FTP.
trans-unit.target: How to publish your application to Azure using FTP.

trans-unit.source: By following this tutorial, you will build a simple registration web app in PHP.
trans-unit.target: By following this tutorial, you will build a simple registration web app in PHP.

trans-unit.source: The application will be hosted in a Web App.
trans-unit.target: The application will be hosted in a Web App.

trans-unit.source: A screenshot of the completed application is below:
trans-unit.target: A screenshot of the completed application is below:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure PHP Web Site</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure PHP Web Site</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an account, go to <linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an account, go to <linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required, no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required, no commitments.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to create a web app and a MySQL database:
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to create a web app and a MySQL database:

trans-unit.source: Login to the <linkText>Azure Portal[management-portal]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Login to the <linkText>Azure Portal[management-portal]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click the + New icon on the bottom left of the portal.
trans-unit.target: Click the + New icon on the bottom left of the portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create New Azure Web Site</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create New Azure Web Site</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Web + Mobile, then Web app + MySQL.
trans-unit.target: Click Web + Mobile, then Web app + MySQL.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Custom Create a new Web Site</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Custom Create a new Web Site</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter a valid name for your resource group.
trans-unit.target: Enter a valid name for your resource group.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Set resource group name</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Set resource group name</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter values for your new web app.
trans-unit.target: Enter values for your new web app.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create web app</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create web app</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter values for your new database, including agreeing to the legal terms.
trans-unit.target: Enter values for your new database, including agreeing to the legal terms.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create new MySQL database</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create new MySQL database</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When the web app has been created, you will see the new resource group.
trans-unit.target: When the web app has been created, you will see the new resource group.

trans-unit.source: Click the name of the web app to configure its settings.
trans-unit.target: Click the name of the web app to configure its settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Open web app</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Open web app</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Scroll down until you find Set deployment credentials.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down until you find Set deployment credentials.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Set deployment credentials</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Set deployment credentials</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To enable FTP publishing, you must provide a user name and password.
trans-unit.target: To enable FTP publishing, you must provide a user name and password.

trans-unit.source: Save the credentials and make a note of the user name and password you create.
trans-unit.target: Save the credentials and make a note of the user name and password you create.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create publishing credentials</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create publishing credentials</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Registration application is a simple PHP application that allows you to register for an event by providing your name and email address.
trans-unit.target: The Registration application is a simple PHP application that allows you to register for an event by providing your name and email address.

trans-unit.source: Information about previous registrants is displayed in a table.
trans-unit.target: Information about previous registrants is displayed in a table.

trans-unit.source: Registration information is stored in a MySQL database.
trans-unit.target: Registration information is stored in a MySQL database.

trans-unit.source: The app consists of two files:
trans-unit.target: The app consists of two files:

trans-unit.source: index.php: Displays a form for registration and a table containing registrant information.
trans-unit.target: index.php: Displays a form for registration and a table containing registrant information.

trans-unit.source: createtable.php: Creates the MySQL table for the application.
trans-unit.target: createtable.php: Creates the MySQL table for the application.

trans-unit.source: This file will only be used once.
trans-unit.target: This file will only be used once.

trans-unit.source: To build and run the app locally, follow the steps below.
trans-unit.target: To build and run the app locally, follow the steps below.

trans-unit.source: Note that these steps assume you have PHP, MySQL, and a web server set up on your local machine, and that you have enabled the <linkText>PDO extension for MySQL[pdo-mysql]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Note that these steps assume you have PHP, MySQL, and a web server set up on your local machine, and that you have enabled the <linkText>PDO extension for MySQL[pdo-mysql]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Create a MySQL database called registration.
trans-unit.target: Create a MySQL database called registration.

trans-unit.source: You can do this from the MySQL command prompt with this command:
trans-unit.target: You can do this from the MySQL command prompt with this command:

trans-unit.source: In your web server's root directory, create a folder called registration and create two files in it - one called createtable.php and one called index.php.
trans-unit.target: In your web server's root directory, create a folder called registration and create two files in it - one called createtable.php and one called index.php.

trans-unit.source: Open the createtable.php file in a text editor or IDE and add the code below.
trans-unit.target: Open the createtable.php file in a text editor or IDE and add the code below.

trans-unit.source: This code will be used to create the registration_tbl table in the registration database.
trans-unit.target: This code will be used to create the registration_tbl table in the registration database.

trans-unit.source: You will need to update the values for $user and $pwd with your local MySQL user name and password.
trans-unit.target: You will need to update the values for $user and $pwd with your local MySQL user name and password.

trans-unit.source: Open a web browser and browse to <linkText>http://localhost/registration/createtable.php[localhost-createtable]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Open a web browser and browse to <linkText>http://localhost/registration/createtable.php[localhost-createtable]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This will create the registration_tbl table in the database.
trans-unit.target: This will create the registration_tbl table in the database.

trans-unit.source: Open the index.php file in a text editor or IDE and add the basic HTML and CSS code for the page (the PHP code will be added in later steps).
trans-unit.target: Open the index.php file in a text editor or IDE and add the basic HTML and CSS code for the page (the PHP code will be added in later steps).

trans-unit.source: Within the PHP tags, add PHP code for connecting to the database.
trans-unit.target: Within the PHP tags, add PHP code for connecting to the database.

trans-unit.source: Again, you will need to update the values for $user and $pwd with your local MySQL user name and password.
trans-unit.target: Again, you will need to update the values for $user and $pwd with your local MySQL user name and password.

trans-unit.source: Following the database connection code, add code for inserting registration information into the database.
trans-unit.target: Following the database connection code, add code for inserting registration information into the database.

trans-unit.source: Finally, following the code above, add code for retrieving data from the database.
trans-unit.target: Finally, following the code above, add code for retrieving data from the database.

trans-unit.source: You can now browse to <linkText>http://localhost/registration/index.php[localhost-index]</linkText><title></title> to test the app.
trans-unit.target: You can now browse to <linkText>http://localhost/registration/index.php[localhost-index]</linkText><title></title> to test the app.

trans-unit.source: To connect to the MySQL database that is running in Web Apps, your will need the connection information.
trans-unit.target: To connect to the MySQL database that is running in Web Apps, your will need the connection information.

trans-unit.source: To get MySQL connection information, follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: To get MySQL connection information, follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: From your resource group, click the database:
trans-unit.target: From your resource group, click the database:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select database</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select database</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the database sumamry, select Properties.
trans-unit.target: From the database sumamry, select Properties.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select properties</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select properties</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Make note of the values for Database, Host, User Id, and Password.
trans-unit.target: Make note of the values for Database, Host, User Id, and Password.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Note properties</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Note properties</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From your web app, click the Download publish profile link at the bottom right corner of the page:
trans-unit.target: From your web app, click the Download publish profile link at the bottom right corner of the page:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Download publish profile</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Download publish profile</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Open the .publishsettings file in an XML editor.
trans-unit.target: Open the .publishsettings file in an XML editor.

trans-unit.source: Find the element with publishMethod="FTP" that looks similar to this:
trans-unit.target: Find the element with publishMethod="FTP" that looks similar to this:

trans-unit.source: Make note of the publishUrl, userName, and userPWD attributes.
trans-unit.target: Make note of the publishUrl, userName, and userPWD attributes.

trans-unit.source: After you have tested your app locally, you can publish it to your web app using FTP.
trans-unit.target: After you have tested your app locally, you can publish it to your web app using FTP.

trans-unit.source: However, you first need to update the database connection information in the application.
trans-unit.target: However, you first need to update the database connection information in the application.

trans-unit.source: Using the database connection information you obtained earlier (in the Get MySQL and FTP connection information section), update the following information in both the createdatabase.php and index.php files with the appropriate values:
trans-unit.target: Using the database connection information you obtained earlier (in the Get MySQL and FTP connection information section), update the following information in both the createdatabase.php and index.php files with the appropriate values:

trans-unit.source: Now you are ready to publish your app using FTP.
trans-unit.target: Now you are ready to publish your app using FTP.

trans-unit.source: Open your FTP client of choice.
trans-unit.target: Open your FTP client of choice.

trans-unit.source: Enter the host name portion from the publishUrl attribute you noted above into your FTP client.
trans-unit.target: Enter the host name portion from the publishUrl attribute you noted above into your FTP client.

trans-unit.source: Enter the userName and userPWD attributes you noted above unchanged into your FTP client.
trans-unit.target: Enter the userName and userPWD attributes you noted above unchanged into your FTP client.

trans-unit.source: Establish a connection.
trans-unit.target: Establish a connection.

trans-unit.source: After you have connected you will be able to upload and download files as needed.
trans-unit.target: After you have connected you will be able to upload and download files as needed.

trans-unit.source: Be sure that you are uploading files to the root directory, which is /site/wwwroot.
trans-unit.target: Be sure that you are uploading files to the root directory, which is /site/wwwroot.

trans-unit.source: After uploading both index.php and createtable.php, browse to http://[site name].azurewebsites.net/createtable.php to create the MySQL table for the application, then browse to http://[site name].azurewebsites.net/index.php to begin using the application.
trans-unit.target: After uploading both index.php and createtable.php, browse to http://[site name].azurewebsites.net/createtable.php to create the MySQL table for the application, then browse to http://[site name].azurewebsites.net/index.php to begin using the application.

trans-unit.target: http://www.php.net/manual/en/install.php

trans-unit.target: http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/installing.html

trans-unit.source: http://www.php.net/manual/en/ref.pdo-mysql.php
trans-unit.target: http://www.php.net/manual/en/ref.pdo-mysql.php

trans-unit.target: http://localhost/tasklist/createtable.php

trans-unit.source: http://localhost/tasklist/index.php
trans-unit.target: http://localhost/tasklist/index.php
